note.p: Education: Grammar School, Aberdeen; King's College, Aberdeen. MA (1861, LLD (1884). Trinity College, Cambridge. (BA 1866), MA (1869)

Career: Fellow (1867) and Assistant Tutor, Trinity College, Cambridge; Professor of Mathematics, Royal Engineering College, Cooper's Hill (1867); Professor of Mathematics, Royal Military Academy, Woolwich; Director of Studies, Royal Naval College, Greenwich (1882-1903); literary executor and editor of collected papers of James Clerk Maxwell (FRS 1861); retired to Sidcup, Kent
